sen.j: 小堀 正次（こぼり まさつぐ、1540年（天文 (元号)9年）- 1604年4月29日（慶長9年3月30日 (旧暦)））は、戦国時代 (日本)から江戸時代前期にかけての大名。
sen.e: Masatsugu KOBORI (1540-April 29, 1604) was daimyo (a feudal lord) who lived during the Sengoku period and the early Edo period.

sen.j: 天文 (元号)9年（1540年）近江国坂田郡小堀村（現・滋賀県長浜市）に生まれ、一旦は出家しているが還俗して磯野員正の娘と結婚している。
sen.e: He was born in 1540 in Kobori-mura, Sakata-gun, Omi-no-kuni (present-day Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture); although he once became a priest he returned to secular life and married a daughter of Kazumasa ISONO.

sen.j: 磯野員正が浅井家から離反したことにより再び出家するが、またもや還俗して豊臣秀長に仕えることになる。
sen.e: He became a priest again when Kazumasa ISONO estranged himself from the Asai clan, but he returned to secular life again and served Hidenaga TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 最初は1000石の知領だったが、秀長・豊臣秀吉のもとで政治手腕を買われて、主に紀伊国や大和国の検地代官を務めた（紀伊や大和は寺社勢力が多く、検地が容易でない事からも、その手腕を買われていた事がわかる）。
sen.e: In the beginning he owned a territory of 1,000-koku (a unit of volume), but as he showed his skill in politics while serving Hidenaga TYOTOMI and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, he became a land survey official mainly in Kii and Yamato Provinces (this we also know from the fact that, since the temple and shrine powers in Kii and Yamato Provinces were strong, the land survey there was not easy and required a skilled land survey official).
sen.cmt: 【主に紀伊国や大和国の検地代官を務め】となっており、本来は下のセルと結合されるべきだったようですが、【務めた】に変更し文章を終わらせました。
sen.e: In the beginning he owned a territory of 1,000 koku crop yield, but as he showed his skill in politics while serving Hidenaga TOYOTOMI and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, he became a land survey official mainly in Kii and Yamato Provinces (which shows he was appreciated his ability, since the land survey in Kii and Yamato Provinces was not easy as the temple and shrine powers there were strong).

sen.j: 次第に加増して5000石に達した。

sen.j: 秀長の没後は、秀吉に仕えて大和・和泉・紀伊において郡代に任ぜられている。
sen.e: After Hidenaga's death, Masatsugu served Hideyoshi and was appointed to gundai (intendant of a region or administrator of a town) in Yamato, Izumi, and Kii Provinces.

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）の関ヶ原の戦いでは東軍に属し、上杉景勝討伐軍に従軍。
sen.e: In Battle of Sekigahara in 1600, he belonged to the Eastern Camp and took a part in a punitive force for subjugation of Kagekatsu UESUGI.

sen.j: 戦後、備中国備中松山藩に1万4000石を与えられ、備中における天領の管理も任された。
sen.e: After the war, he was given 14,000-koku in the domain of Bicchu-matsuyama in Bicchu Province, and was entrusted the management of tenryo (bakufu-owned land) in Bicchu.
After the battle, he was given 14,000 koku in the Bitchu-Matsuyama Domain in Bitchu Province, and was entrusted the management of tenryo (shogunate-owned land) in Bitchu.

sen.j: また、備中や近江国における幕府の検地などにおいても、大いに功績を挙げ、1601年には、伏見城の作事奉行も務めている。
sen.e: Furthermore, he rendered remarkable services in surveying the land of bakufu in Bicchu and Omi Provinces; in 1601, he served as sakuji bugyo (commissioners of building) in Fushimi-jo Castle.

sen.j: 慶長9年（1604年）、江戸へ参勤に向かう途上藤沢で急死。
sen.e: In 1604 he died suddenly in Fujisawa on the way to Edo for sankin (daimyo's alternate-year residence in Edo).
